data.text: @Mae522018 @LCalabreseDO @EricTopol @CCalabreseDO What the hell, are we the same person? Literally all you have said applies to me.

@LongDesertTrain @EricTopol Do you think this was communicated well?
So the actual size of the problems is actual very small compared to the many other healt proplems needing more attention.
@LCalabreseDO @EricTopol @CCalabreseDO Burning skin/stinging hands and feet started for me 2 weeks after vax. Have a dx of POTs, but neuro won’t do a punch biopsy for Small Fiber Neuropathy 😡
@myrtoashe @Grutzmac @theoy991 @EricTopol There are no large, well designed studies showing PASC is at all common post vaccination. You are referring to self reporting biased studies.

@LongDesertTrain @Unusual_Times @EricTopol @dgurdasani1 Two different stages/components of the study. Prospective analysis of the cross-section of patients to be eval'd (pre-study/beginning of study) vs. retrospective once the study was completed. I agree they might have used better language here
@EricTopol How many were vaccinated….that is pretty important data

@LCalabreseDO @EricTopol @CCalabreseDO My neuro symptoms kicked in 2 weeks post 1 Pfizer vaccine. Debilitating for 9 mo & counting! No tests or treatment from the NHS. Didn’t go back for a second dose despite being encouraged to 🤯 We must acknowledge & learn from adverse events.
@antoniottwalter @EricTopol They are two different studies. One looked at 17 subjects, the other 40. Both selected Covid patients who had reported neurological symptoms.

@americanadianTO @Grutzmac @EricTopol Just noticed you asked about "vaxxed and boosted" patients. I believe the studies referred to above only analyzed 2-dose-vaccinated subjects. I'm not sure if there's ben enough time for good studies on long Covid in 3-dosers.
@doctorsaluja @EricTopol @ahandvanish With approximately what percentage of patients do you see this sort of autonomic dysfunction in acute Covid cases?
